channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4790] A brilliant reminder of what forever looks like... [PIC]
[+4005] Sarah Palin Threatens To Sue Entire Internet, Via Twitter
item.description: How did you spend the Fourth of July? Batshit-insane American Quitter Sarah Palin ended her own special “Independence Day” by posting a series of desperate grammar-challenged nonsense and vicious threats on her Facebook and Twitter pages. Really.

item.title: [+2826] Fully reveals the shocking truth
[+2611] O_o Cat [PIC]
[+2024] Banksy vs. Bristol Museum
[+1855] Happy Plane [PIC]
[+1692] Nova Science: How Auto-Tune Works
item.description: What puts the pain in T-Pain? How the hell did Reba McEntire win all those Grammys? Dr. Andy Hildebrand knows the secret and he's telling.

item.title: [+1628] Dirtiest Dreads You've Ever Seen
[+1549] Mama, can we have a pet like this in the house? [pics]
item.description: There are no any law regulations on what pets you can keep and what you can’t, no PETA, no need to pick up your little friend’s poo in special bags. You can walk with your pet anywhere on the street or public park, no any single “no pets allowed” signs outside. Some call it chaos others call it freedom, you decide yourself.

item.title: [+1416] Navy may discharge seaman after discovery of sex games
item.description: The Defense Department has confirmed it is investigating claims Australian sailors engaged in a sex-for-money competition.

item.title: [+1188] Royal Guards Perform Thriller MJ Tribute
item.description: The UK's Band of the Coldstream Guards unexpectedly perform Michael Jackson's Thriller

item.title: [+1148] Magnificent Image Of The New Hoover Dam Bridge Taking Shape
item.description: The picture of the new Hoover Damn bridge above the Colorado river looks pretty amazing

item.title: [+1065] MI6 chief's cover blown by wife's holiday pics on Facebook
item.description: The new head of MI6, Sir John Sawers, is at the centre of a security breach after his wife published family holiday photographs and other personal details on the Facebook website.

item.title: [+908] OpenBitTorrent Tracker Muscles In On The Old Pirate Bay
item.description: On Friday Jamie King, director of the Steal This Film documentaries, speculated here on TorrentFreak that the brand new OpenBitTorrent tracker could prove to be a replacement for The Pirate Bay if certain conditions were met. Now, just 48 hours later - has that dream already become reality?

item.title: [+849] Whattaya Call That Thing?
[+773] Federer Beats Roddick In Epic Final
item.description: Roger Federer made tennis history at Wimbledon Sunday, defeating Andy Roddick 16-14 in the fifth to claim his 15th career major and surpass Pete Sampras' record for most Grand Slam singles titles

item.title: [+773] Why iPod Touch Owners Shouldn't Upgrade to OS 3.0
item.description: With all the hoopla about the iPhone 3GS's speed, what about its little non-cellular brother, the iPod touch? We upgraded the touch to OS 3.0, then ran a variety of real-world tests. The results were convincing.

item.title: [+750] What Your Gadget Really Costs
item.description: Market research company iSuppli takes it upon itself to tear down popular gadgets to find out the price of the component parts and the vendors supplying those ingredients. A rundown of several recent iSuppli teardowns follows...

item.title: [+725] Microsoft drops vomiting ad after complaints [VIDEO]
item.description: A controversial Microsoft ad campaign featuring a vomiting woman has been dropped by the software company after customer complaints

item.title: [+698] Michael Jackson to be buried without his brain
item.description: Michael Jackson will be buried this week– without his brain. As his family tries to finalise details for the King of Pop’s funeral on Tuesday they have been told it will be held back for tests.
